Question.Subject: How come I can get online through the a browser, but I can't get online through games?
Question.Content: Okay so I like to play internet games (Diablo and Warcraft 3) on my spare time (usually around night). So last night I got on one of my games, and it said I wasn't able to get online. I went onto something called Steam, when I tried to log in, it said it was having problems. Today I decided to borrow a bunch of 'online' games from some friends, I installed them and had the same problem which each one. How come I can use internet to do things such as yahoo, but I can't use my internet to play games? I turned my modem/router on and off. I recycled them. Reset them. Gave them new names. Called my internet provider (who dropped me 2 minutes into conversation, almost four times too) and no good came out of that. And now recently my internet in general is becoming slower and more harder to work with. I have my own laptop and just recently I have been buying my own internet.
Question.ChosenAnswer: it seem that ur parents might have used the parental control option generally given in anti virus this prevent opening or porn and games site generally . it can be a case of virus too scan ur computer first and ask ur parents too or go to anti-virus menu find the option and disable it. generally this option is password protected. it will be under the heading online security.

Answer.Content: maybe your parrents are using a net nanny

it seem that ur parents might have used the parental control option generally given in anti virus this prevent opening or porn and games site generally . it can be a case of virus too scan ur computer first and ask ur parents too or go to anti-virus menu find the option and disable it. generally this option is password protected. it will be under the heading online security.
Answer.Reference: i set it on my computer
